title: Landmark Legislation
description: Test your knowledge of the most important laws and acts that changed history

questions.question: The Social Security Act, establishing retirement benefits and unemployment insurance in the U.S., was signed in which year?
The National Health Service (NHS) was established in the United Kingdom in which year?
The Homestead Act of 1862 in the U.S. encouraged westward expansion by offering what to settlers?
The Clean Air Act of 1970 in the United States was designed to do what?
options: Control air pollution on a national level

questions.question: Which U.S. law, passed in 1890, was the first federal legislation to limit monopolies and trusts?
The GI Bill, officially the Servicemen's Readjustment Act, provided benefits to veterans of which war?
India's Right to Information Act, giving citizens the right to access government records, was passed in which year?
The Endangered Species Act in the U.S. was enacted in which year?
The Abolition of the Slave Trade Act was passed by the British Parliament in which year?
The Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) was signed into law in which year?
The Affordable Care Act (ACA), also known as 'Obamacare,' was signed into law in which year?
France's Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen was adopted during which event?
The Indian Constitution, the longest written constitution in the world, came into effect in which year?
The New Deal, a series of programs and reforms during the Great Depression, was introduced by which president?
The Equal Pay Act of 1963 in the U.S. aimed to abolish wage disparity based on what?
